Name: Battle of the Boyne
Opening Hours:
Open all year.

Mar-Apr:  	Daily 	09:30-17:30 	 
May-Sep: 	Daily 	10:00-18:00

Centre is accessible to visitors with disabilities - including the Pavillion Tea Room and toilet facilities.

Name: Castletown House and Parklands

Name: Dublin Castle
Opening Hours:
Open all Year Round:
                      Mon - Sat: 09:45 - 16:45
Sun & Bank Holidays: 10:45 - 16:45
Closed: 25, 26 & 27 Dec & 1 Jan.
Last admission at 16.45

Average Length of Visit: 1 hour.

Admission is by guided tour. A self guiding option also available.  Information is available in 13 languages. Advanced booking is required for both Guided and Self-Guided Groups.

Please note that as Dublin Castle is a working Irish Government building, security, access to rooms and opening arrangements may be subject to change at short notice. Apologies for any inconvenience caused.
Admission Charges:
Guided Tour (1hr 5min) (State Apartments, Medieval Undercroft and Chapel Royal) 
Adult: EUR 10.00
Student/Senior (60+): EUR 8.00
Group: EUR 5.50
Children: EUR 4.00
Family: EUR 24.00

Self-Guide (State Apartments and Exhibitions) 
Adult: EUR 7.00
Student/Senior (60+): EUR 6.00
Group: EUR 5.50
Children: EUR 3.00
Family: EUR 17.00
Facilities: Tea Rooms, Gift Shop, Toilets, Toilets for Visitors with disabilities.

Name: Sceilg Mhichil (Great Skellig Rock [Skellig Michael])
Address:
Boats trips can be made from one of the following:
1. Ballinskelligs Pier, Baile an Sceilg (Ballinskelligs) 
2. The Marina, Portmagee
3. Knightstown Harbour, Valentia Island
4. Bunavalla Pier, Bunavalla, Caherdaniel
Opening Hours:
Guide Service Available: 
15 May-2 Oct 2016 - Weather Permitting.

At all other times this site is unmanned and visits are prohibited.

Opening arrangements are variable, depending on weather conditions.

Average Length of Visit: 2.5 hours (excluding boat trip)

PLEASE NOTE: The use of drones on Skellig Michael is not permitted.
Admission Charges:
Free of Charge

Separate charge imposed by boat operator(s).
Facilities:
None (Please note that there are no toilets.  Visitors are advised to carry water and to wear protective clothing)

Camping is strictly prohibited.
Restaurant/Tearooms: None

Additional Information:

Please note that access is dependent on tidal/weather conditions. Children must be strictly supervised at all times. This is a particularly vulnerable site and visitors are therefore asked to co-operate with our efforts to protect this monument. No animals are allowed on this site.

Name: Wicklow Mountains National Park
Opening Hours:
Opening Arrangements: The Education Centre operates Monday to Friday, throughout the year. Booking is essential.

The Information Office is open seasonally:
May - September: Open Daily 10:00 hrs - 17:30 hrs
October: Weekends only 10:00 hrs  - 17:30hr
Admission Charges: Free
Facilities:
The Information Office has hands-on exhibitions and a staff member to answer questions.
A series of way-marked walking trails guides visitors on routes of 30 minutes to four hours. Some of these are wheelchair friendly. Maps are sold in the Information
